item.description:
It happened to Irene Garjian of Easthampton, MA!

Irene bought some old photographs at a local yard sale, paying 50 cents for the lot. A little research found them to be the work of Harold Edgarton, an electrical engineer at MIT. He had taken the pictures using a strobe light he developed. The amazing photographs included one of a speeding bullet. Even more surprising was their worth - Sotheby's expected them to sell for $6,000 - $9,000 at auction.
(link: http://www.prlog.org/...

How can you tell if there is treasure in your clutter? How do you know what things are worth? And how do you sell them?

Our dinner discussion will cover how to research your items, and sucessful selling tips for Craigslist and eBay. Learn how to differentiate random clutter from valuable items.

(Dinner is not included; Tango Mango is an inexpensive Mexican eatery. Link: http://www.boston.com...)

See you there!

group.name: Tools for Decluttering, Personal Change & Goal Attainment

item.name: Quesadillas, eBay and Craigslist: How to Sell Your Clutter
